sentences.en: (= about people who have just died ) in the newspaper
sentences.cn: 报纸上的讣告

sentences.en: All flights to Lanchow had been cancelled until further notice.
sentences.cn: 所有飞往兰州的航班都已取消，何时恢复另行通知。

sentences.en: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.cn: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

sentences.en: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.cn: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.en: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.cn: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.en: I am so glad that you have brought this to my notice.
sentences.cn: 我很高兴你让我注意到了这件事情。

sentences.en: I couldn’t help noticing the bruises on her arm.
sentences.cn: 我一眼就注意到她手臂上的瘀伤。

sentences.en: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.cn: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.en: I hope you’ll take notice of what I’m going to tell you.
sentences.cn: 我希望你留心听我下面要对你讲的话。

sentences.en: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.cn: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.en: I’ll put up a notice about the meeting.
sentences.cn: 我会贴一张会议通告的。

sentences.en: Interest is paid monthly. Three months' notice is required for withdrawals.
sentences.cn: 利息按月支付。提款须提前3个月通知银行。

sentences.en: It's not a case of whether anyone would notice or not.
sentences.cn: 这不是会不会有人注意到的问题。

sentences.en: Precious few homebuyers will notice any reduction in their monthly repayments.
sentences.cn: 极少数购房者会注意到他们月还款额的减少。

sentences.en: She did not notice the man until he moved into her path.
sentences.cn: 直到那个男人拦住她的去路，她才注意到他。

sentences.en: She was transferred without notice.
sentences.cn: 她事先没接到通知就被调走了。

sentences.en: She's nervous about something, in case you didn't notice.
sentences.cn: 她正为了什么事神经紧张，你连这个都没看出来？

sentences.en: The entire world must take notice of something like this.
sentences.cn: 全世界一定要关注这样的事情。

sentences.en: The notice on the wall said ‘No smoking’.
sentences.cn: 墙上的告示写着“禁止吸烟”。

sentences.en: There are several important matters that I’d like to bring to your notice (= that I would like you to know about ).
sentences.cn: 有几件重要的事我想提醒你注意。

sentences.en: This never came to my notice (= I never knew about this ).
sentences.cn: 我从来没有注意到这一点。

sentences.en: This problem may have escaped your notice so far (= you may not have noticed it ).
sentences.cn: 可能你还没有注意到这个问题。

sentences.en: This should make people sit up and take notice.
sentences.cn: 这件事应引起人们的关注。

sentences.en: Tony didn't notice because he was too engrossed in his work.
sentences.cn: 托尼因为太专注于自己的工作而毫未察觉。

sentences.en: tours may be cancelled at short notice.
sentences.cn: 旅行可能会临时通知取消。

sentences.en: We put a notice on the side of the box.
sentences.cn: 我们在箱子的一侧贴了警示标。

sentences.en: we're going to put foreign governments on notice that we want a change of trade policy.
sentences.cn: 我们将要警告外国政府我们要改变贸易政策。

sentences.en: Why should he notice her car in particular?
sentences.cn: 他为什么会特别注意到她的车？

sentences.en: You notice that your breathing has speeded up a bit.
sentences.cn: 你注意到自己的呼吸加快了一些。

sentences.en: You will probably notice an element of quirkiness in his behaviour.
sentences.cn: 你可能会发现他的行为有点怪异。

words.tran_cn: 著名的；显著的；附有乐谱的
显而易见的，显著的；值得注意的
显著地，明显地；引人注目地
注意；记下（note的过去式和过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 即刻；随时；一经通知就立即
临时通知，提前很短时间通知
在短时间内；立刻，即刻；一通知到就
按事先通知的(地)，被关照过的(地)
刚约就要见（没有给对方充裕的时间）

phrases.phrase: put someone on notice (或 serve notice)
phrases.tran_cn: 正式警告（某人某事将会或可能发生）；正告
不预先通知地；没有事先通知

trans.tran_cn: 注意，通知，预告，启事，短评
trans.tran_en: when you notice or pay attention to someone or something
if someone can’t help noticing something, they realize that it exists or is happening even though they are not deliberately trying to pay attention to it
